item.title: Conception, Construction and Evaluation of a Raspberry Pi Cluster
item.author: Author
item.description: The goal of this work is to create an affordable, energy efficient and portable mini-supercomputer. Ideally, a cluster computer with little or no carbon footprint, individual elements that are inexpensive to replace, and a portable system that can be easily disassembled and reassembled.

item.title: Create your own Cryptocurrency Token (Solana)
item.author: Author
item.description: I created my own crypto Token and I want to show you how to create your own - It only takes about 15-30 minutes.

item.title: How to reload your VSCode Window
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned how to reload/restart my window in Visual Studio Code.

This is especially helpful if you want to restart Visual Studio and leave all your current terminals open.

item.title: Hot and cold Crypto Wallet (Address)
item.author: Author
item.description: Today I learned how to explain the differences between a hot and cold crypto wallet and a wallet address.

item.title: Crypto Tokens, Coins and Mnemonics
item.author: Author
item.description: Today I learned to simply explain the difference between a crypto token, coin and a mnemonic.

item.title: Cold Crypto Wallets and MITM Attacks
item.author: Author
item.description: Are my cold wallet and the generated addresses really secure? I would like to familiarise you with the security topics of cold wallets and what you should pay attention to.

item.title: Create a secure and anonymous Crypto Wallet
item.author: Author
item.description:
Creating a wallet address (Bitcoin/Ethereum) is easy, but is it really secure?

In this article we look at a secure but also anonymous approach using tools like Live USB BitKey to create your own anonymous crypto wallet you can trust.

item.title: Automatically clean up local once remote branch is deleted
item.author: Author
item.description: Use this nice PowerShell one-liner to automatically clean up (delete) your local branches once your remote branches is deleted (merged).

item.title: Clean Up and Sync Your Git Fork
item.author: Author
item.description: If you want to start with your fork from scratch while remaining the current upstream/main as your base use this.

item.title: Find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned How to find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code.

In the local searchbox (Ctrl + F) you can insert newlines by pressing Ctrl + Enter.
